Adaptations Teacher's Kit

Lessons for teaching “Adaptations of living organisms” to year levels 5/6 of the Australian Curriculum

This kit has been developed by Deakin University, The University of Melbourne, the Gene Technology Access Centre (GTAC) and Museum Victoria, thanks to the Reconceptualising Mathematics and Science Teacher Education Programs (ReMSTEP) project.

Module overview Menu

Adaptations

Module 1
Close

Adaptations Teacher's Kit - Menu

Module 1 - Introduction
Flowers and bees rely on each other for their survival and are mutually rewarded.

  1. Lesson 1
    Establishing prior knowledge and questions to investigate the statement: One in every three mouthfuls of food we eat relies on bees
  2. Lesson 2
    Establishing prior knowledge and questions to investigate the statement: One in every three mouthfuls of food we eat relies on bees
  3. Lesson 3
    Establishing prior knowledge and questions to investigate the statement: One in every three mouthfuls of food we eat relies on bees
  4. Lesson 4
    Establishing prior knowledge and questions to investigate the statement: One in every three mouthfuls of food we eat relies on bees
